articles.title: As SJC mulls involvement in public defender work stoppage, here’s where things stand
articles.description:
While a modest pay raise eased the crisis somewhat, more than 900 defendants are still without representation.

The post As SJC mulls involvement in public defender work stoppage, here’s where things stand appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: SJC considers involvement in public defender work stoppage affecting Boston's legal system.
Over 900 defendants in Boston remain without legal representation amid ongoing issues.
Recent pay raise for public defenders has not fully resolved staffing shortages.

articles.title: Reese Witherspoon visits Boston bookstore
articles.description:
She signed copies of her latest book while in town for a discussion at Harvard Business School.

summary: Reese Witherspoon signed copies of her book at a Boston bookstore on November 6, 2025.
She was in town for a discussion at Harvard Business School, engaging with local students.
The event boosted local bookstore sales and attracted fans, enhancing community cultural engagement.

articles.title: GOP lawmakers pushing Healey for info on aide arrested in cocaine bust
articles.description:
A Healey staffer’s cocaine trafficking arrest raises “serious questions” about the governor’s vetting processes, Republican lawmakers said.

summary: GOP lawmakers demand transparency from Governor Healey regarding aide's cocaine trafficking arrest.
The arrest raises concerns about the vetting process for state employees.
Local residents may question the integrity of state leadership following this incident.

articles.title: 2 teens killed in New Bedford crash identified
articles.description:
One of the victims was a senior at Dennis-Yarmouth Regional High School, the other a 15-year-old girl.

summary: Two teens died in a crash in New Bedford on November 6.
One victim was a senior at Dennis-Yarmouth Regional High School.
The incident raises concerns about teen driving safety in the region.

articles.title: BPD releases multiple photos of baseball-capped commercial burglary suspect
articles.description:
The string of burglaries reportedly started in late August.

summary: BPD seeks public help identifying a suspect in commercial burglaries since late August.

Increased vigilance urged among Boston businesses to prevent further burglaries.

articles.title: Report: Mike Vrabel’s former team was ‘unwilling’ to trade with Patriots
articles.description:
Apparently, the Titans owner didn't want to do anything to help the Patriots.

summary: Titans owner refused to trade with the Patriots, impacting team strategy.
Mike Vrabel's former team, the Titans, showed unwillingness to assist on trades.
This decision may hinder Patriots' roster improvements ahead of the season.

articles.title: Following a career night, Josh Minott isn’t taking his starting role for granted
articles.description:
"At the end of the day, every time I go out I just assume that it can always be taken from me."

The post Following a career night, Josh Minott isn’t taking his starting role for granted appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Josh Minott reflects on his starting role after a career-high performance.
Minott emphasizes the importance of consistency in his game for the Celtics.
Boston fans can expect heightened competition as Minott aims to secure his position.

articles.title: Are the New England Patriots back? Here’s what 200 readers said.
articles.description:
Despite a six-game win streak, many readers say the Patriots still haven’t "played a worthy opponent yet."

The post Are the New England Patriots back? Here’s what 200 readers said. appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: 200 Boston readers express skepticism about the Patriots' six-game win streak.
Many believe the team hasn't faced a strong opponent yet this season.
Local fans remain cautious about the team's performance heading into the playoffs.
